document.docAuthor: Mauro-Barr, T. T., Carvalho, R. A., Felix, M. & Mejdalani, G.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of the Neotropical leafhopper genus Exogonia with description of seven new Brazilian species (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Cicadellini)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 66–75.
Exogonia hyalinosparsa (Melichar, 1932)
: (66) body, lateral view; (67-69) crown, pronotum, and mesonotum, dorsal view; (70-75) male genitalia: (70) pygofer, lateral view; (71) subgenital plate, ventral view; (72) connective and style, dorsal view; (73) aedeagus and basal portion of gonoduct, lateral view; (74) paraphyses, lateral view; (75) paraphyses, dorsal view. Specimens from Paraná State.

FIGURES 76–80. (76–79)
Exogonia hyalinosparsa (Melichar, 1932)
, female genitalia: (76, 77) sternite VII, ventral view; (78) pygofer, lateral view; (79) second valvula, lateral view. (80)
E. leucampix ( Signoret, 1853 )
, anterior dorsum.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female genitalia. Sternite VII ( Figs 76, 77 ) longer than broad; lateral margins convergent posteriorly; apical portion slightly transversely striate, with short sparse setae; apex pronounced with three small lobes (much more pronounced and without lobes in specimens from Espírito Santo State , Fig. 77 ), median lobe shorter than lateral ones. Pygofer ( Fig. 78 ) as in
E. flavomaculata
. Second valvulae ( Fig. 79 ), in lateral view, with shaft narrowing toward subacute apex; preapical prominence absent or only slightly developed; basal teeth large and rectangular (the first three may be small and triangular in specimens from Espírito Santo State ), followed by gradually smaller ones. Other features of second valvulae as in
E. flavomaculata
.

Material examined .
Brazil : Espírito Santo, Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo, Paraná , and Santa Catarina states. One female, “ESP. SANTO
, 9 E 10 – 944[1944]\ RIB . ENGANO\ VALE
